FRML24113-119.heading: Traceability Matrix
FRML24113-119.content: The test coverage is captured in the traceability matrix which maps user requirements and functional specifications to test cases. The traceability matrix has been updated prior to execution of the test cases and has been archived in the validation archive (add a reference).

FRML24113-118.heading: Non-Functional Testing Results
FRML24113-118.content:
Non-Functional testing was performed according to the approved functional / requirements test plan (final v1.0), approved on <date>.

The test execution run of the non-functional test cases was performed on Mar 03. All the test cases of the project were executed without significant failures.

FRML24113-117.heading: Discrepancy Log
FRML24113-117.content: All failures and problems which have been observed during testing have been collected in a discrepancy log. The discrepancy log is attached to this report.

FRML24113-116.heading: Responsibilities and Signature Resource Log
FRML24113-116.content: All Testers and Test Administrators have signed the signature resource log prior to the start of testing activities. The signature resource log is attached to this report.

FRML24113-115.heading: Training
FRML24113-115.content: All Testers and Test Administrators have been trained prior to the start of testing activities. Two classroom trainings have been performed on 23-Apr-2001 in Ingelheim and on 26-Apr-2011 in Ridgefield. Copies of the training records and agenda are attached to this report.

FRML24113-114.heading: Testing Environment
FRML24113-114.content: All integration and acceptance test cases have been executed in the qualified validation environment as defined in the combined functional / requirements testing plan (ref).

FRML24113-113.heading: Purpose
FRML24113-113.content: The purpose of this document is to report on testing activities that were performed according to the functional / requirements testing plan, to summarize and asses all failed and skipped test cases, and decide if the System name can be formally released for installation in production environment.

FRML24113-108.heading: Traceability Matrix
FRML24113-108.content: The test coverage is captured in the traceability matrix which maps user requirements and functional specifications to test cases. The traceability matrix will be updated before test execution to include all functional and requirements test cases.

FRML24113-107.heading: Test Cases
FRML24113-107.content:
Risk Priority Level of Testing
3 No testing required
2 Testing of functionality or requirements without challenge/boundary tests
1 Full test of requirement or functionality including challenge/boundary tests (e.g. invalid, borderline or missing input values, out-of-order execution of functions, disconnected interfaces etc.)

FRML24113-106.heading: Scope of Non-Functional Testing

FRML24113-105.heading: Scope of Functional Testing
FRML24113-105.content:
The System name is commercial off-the-shelf software which was configured according to the configuration specification. Since some user requirements could not be fulfilled via configuration and therefore have been implemented by in-house developed customizations.
* Functional testing will be performed to verify correct functionality of all customizations, i.e. functional specifications will be 100% covered by functional test cases.
* Configuration specification will not be tested on a functional level, but only implicitly in acceptance test cases.
* Standard product functionality will not be tested in functional testing since appropriate testing has already performed by the vendor. This has been verified in a vendor audit.

FRML24113-104.heading: Scope of Integration Testing
FRML24113-104.content:
The System name is commercial off-the-shelf software which was configured according to the configuration specification. Since some user requirements could not be fulfilled via configuration and therefore have been implemented by in-house developed customizations.
* Integration testing will be performed to verify correct functionality of all customizations, i.e. functional specifications will be 100% covered by functional test cases.
* Configuration specification will not be tested on an integration level, but only implicitly in acceptance test cases.
* Standard product functionality will not be tested in integration testing since appropriate testing has already performed by the vendor. This has been verified in a vendor audit.

FRML24113-103.heading: Test Procedure 2: Verification of Training Documentation
FRML24113-103.content:
Before Integration Testing can start, the Integration Testing participants have to be trained in
* the testing process
* the use of the <insert system name> system

FRML24113-102.heading: Operational Qualification Activities and Training
FRML24113-102.content:
Before test execution the testers will receive formal training on:
* the testing process, including good documentation practice
* a basic end user training for System name
* an overview of the business processes supported by System name

The training will be documented and copies of the training records will be attached to the testing documentation package.
